overview: The purpose of this measure now includes appropriating funds to the Judiciary to implement this measure. [6]
appropriations: This measure will appropriate funds to the Judiciary to implement this measure. [6]
agency_impact: The Committee on Finance noted the suggested amendments from the Department of the Attorney General in its written testimony to clarify that those holding fireworks permits or licenses may continue to use their permits or licenses. [6] The committee also noted suggestions to clarify which law enforcement officers may be designated as administrative inspectors. [6] The Office of the Public Defender raised concerns regarding the concurrent trial provision in this measure. [6]
policy_impact: The Office of the Public Defender asserted that it is the lack of enforcement, rather than the lack or severity of penalties, that has resulted in the low number of charges brought under existing fireworks control laws. [6]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The measure's purpose now explicitly includes appropriating funds to the Judiciary. [6] New testimony was received from the Department of the Attorney General suggesting amendments to clarify the use of permits and licenses and the designation of administrative inspectors. [6] The Office of the Public Defender expressed new concerns about the concurrent trial provision and attributed the low number of fireworks charges to a lack of enforcement rather than inadequate penalties. [6][6] The Committee on Finance received new testimony in support from the Department of Law Enforcement and Honolulu Police Department, and in opposition from the Office of the Public Defender and Libertarian Party of Hawaii. [6][6]
